name: Courtyard by Marriott Denver Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We landed in Denver and stayed here before heading out on our road trip. Very pleasant stay. A new property, everything in the facility was fresh and shiny. Recommended for any traveler looking for consistent quality of Marriott. Nice view from high floors. Wished it were closer to downtown, location is probably what makes it attractively priced.
reviews.title: Stopover Before Starting Road Trip

reviews.text: A really nice business hotel. Lots of airline staff - they usually know value. Bistro cafe very nice. Ha -best oatmeal I ever had. Great to have a newspaper every day. Rooms are rather plain and bed just okay. Area is developing and should have more places to eat soon. Will stay again on business. Nice shuttle drivers too.
reviews.title: Business hotel

reviews.text: This is a newer Courtyard close to DEN. It has the new lobby, and nice new rooms. the front desk was very nice and helpful. the room was great with all the amenities a business traveler would expect.
reviews.title: Great Courtyard close to the Airport

reviews.text: One exception. I called the front desk from the airport and it took 2 tries to speak to a human
reviews.title: Great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here several times this winter and the service was always friendly. Check in is quick and easy and I usually got upgraded to a suite because of my platinum status. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. Even though it's close to the airport, you don't hear any noises from the airport which is a plus. Would definately recommend to others.
reviews.title: Clean, Spacious Rooms, Close to DIA, Free Shuttle

reviews.text: I had to catch a 6-am flight, so I stayed here for one night.
reviews.title: Convenience! Great Shuttle Service!

reviews.text: The shuttle buses offer so much convenience. They come to the Denver airport to pick guests up every 15 minutes or so. Make sure you wait at the right place, and you don't need to call the hotel (unless you want to be picked up between midnight and 4am). They do the same to drop guests off the airport. Be sure to let the front desk know your flight departure time, and they will recommend a time for you to take the shuttle bus.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Near Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drive from the airport to the hotel is about 5-10 minutes.
reviews.title: Overpriced and overcharged!

reviews.text: Sometimes, you might be able to ask the shuttle bus to drop you or pick you up at car rental places. You do need to call in these cases, but most of the drivers are happy to help. (I did, and the driver was very nice to be of help.)
reviews.title: Friendly staff, convenient to airport

reviews.text: You can print your boarding passes at the hotel. They have dedicated terminals for this.
reviews.title: Best Airport hotel!!

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard even though it was a quick stop on a road trip. The hotel was updated and clean. The service was very friendly. I would reccomend this hotel. Also, you do not hear much noise from the airport.
reviews.title: Nice Clean Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel was used due to a 2 day layover, but it was really nice. The only few problems we had was we asked for 2 double beds and got 1 queen bed with the handicapped shower which only went as high as mid chest. The hotel is also in the middle of nowhere.....so if you plan on going anywhere other than the airport, you need to get a cab. Closest place was approximately 20 minutes away by car.
reviews.title: Denver

reviews.text: I stayed at this Courtyard during a quick business trip. The room was comfortable, food was good and service was great. Easy access to the airport but no airport noise.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 days for business and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel is an airport hotel, but it is quite a way from the airport. They have an airport shuttle that runs quite often (I think every 1/2 hour?), which was very handy. During our stay there was a blizzard in town, so it was nice to have good food and Starbucks on-site. There are not many great restaurants in this little "hotel city", so it's nice to be able to eat here. There was a nice italian restaurant within walking distance - Di Cicco's - be sure to check it out. It was excellent! The hotel room was nice and had a great view of the Rocky Mountains. Most of all, it was very clean. You can tell the staff does a thorough cleaning. All staff on site was pleasant and eager to help. I'd definitely return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: Well done. New, clean, well appointed, good food and excellent service in every function.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here on the last night of our Rocky Mountain trip since we had an early flight the next morning. The hotel was beautiful with very comfortable beds and the staff members were extremely friendly and ready to make our stay perfect. I would definitely recommend staying here!!
reviews.title: great hotel - perfect for catching the early flight

reviews.text: There are 6 or 8 hotels grouped together a few miles outside of the airport, and the Courtyard is one of the best selections. This location has everything you would expect from a Courtyard and has a hotel shuttle. I had dinner at the restaurant and was very please. Good service from everyone at the hotel.
reviews.title: Good quality hotel near the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for three nights and had the opportunity to interact with many staff members, to include engineering and lounge attendants. Everyone was wonderfully attentive and responsive. The hotel has been recently renovated and the lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are typical for a Marriott and, with the exception of the suites, feel a little cramped but they are well appointed in traditional Marriott style. What sets this hotel apart is their overall interest in responding to customers needs. You will be comfortable here.
reviews.title: Nicely Remodeled - Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Flew into Denver from East Coast late on Wednesday evening 2 weeks ago . . . arrived at airport at 11pm. Caught shuttle to hotel and on checking in I hesistated and asked . . is 24hr room service available? Desk staff caught me by surprise and told me that the Bistro was open until 1am! Not something I am used to hearing . . . I was able to get a good meal and some wine at midnight down in the lobby area and the restaurant staff were great, very pleasant, couldn't be more helpful. Much more pleasant that a re-heated lasagne or pizza in my room!!
reviews.title: Good service into the early hours

reviews.text: For those using gym facilities note that the hotel only has 3 treadmills so get down to the gym early if you want to avoid the queue...
reviews.title: Great hotel, near airport

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Denver Airport Hotel Denver
